summary: Youth became agitated during group activity and raised voice at staff
description: During the afternoon group activity session, Youth A became increasingly agitated when asked to participate in the team-building exercise. After approximately 10 minutes, the youth raised their voice at staff member John Smith, using inappropriate language. The youth was redirected multiple times but continued to escalate. No physical aggression occurred.
antecedents: Youth had received disappointing news from family earlier in the day. Youth appeared withdrawn during lunch and declined to participate in earlier activities.
behavior: Raised voice, used inappropriate language, refused redirection, paced around room, crossed arms and turned away from staff.
consequences: Youth was given space to calm down. After 15 minutes, youth apologized to staff and agreed to take a break. Youth participated appropriately in evening activities.

witnesses.name: Mary Johnson
witnesses.statement: I observed the youth becoming increasingly agitated. Staff member John Smith handled the situation appropriately with de-escalation techniques.

immediateActions.notes: Used calm voice, offered choices, maintained safe distance

immediateActions.action: Provided space for youth to calm down
immediateActions.notes: Youth moved to quiet corner of room voluntarily
Youth was calm and ready to discuss what happened

followUp.description: Follow up with youth about coping strategies and family communication

additionalNotes: Youth has been doing well overall. This appears to be an isolated incident related to family stress.

summary: Youth complained of severe headache and dizziness, required medical evaluation
description: Youth B approached staff at 9:15 AM complaining of severe headache and dizziness. Youth appeared pale and was holding their head. Staff immediately assessed the situation and determined medical evaluation was necessary. Youth's vital signs were taken: BP 130/85, pulse 88, temp 98.6°F. Youth was able to walk with assistance to the medical office.
antecedents: Youth mentioned not sleeping well the previous night. No recent illness or injury reported.
behavior: Youth appropriately communicated symptoms and cooperated with staff assessment.
consequences: Youth was evaluated by on-site nurse, then transported to urgent care for further evaluation. Diagnosed with migraine headache. Prescribed medication and rest. Youth returned to facility same day.

witnesses.name: Nurse Thompson
witnesses.statement: Youth presented with symptoms consistent with migraine. Vital signs were within normal limits. Recommended urgent care evaluation as precaution.

immediateActions.notes: Youth complained of severe headache and dizziness

medicalDetails: Youth evaluated at Heartland Urgent Care. Diagnosed with migraine headache. Prescribed Ibuprofen 400mg and rest. No concerning findings. Youth returned to facility at 12:30 PM. Follow-up with primary care physician scheduled for next week.

followUp.description: Monitor for recurring headaches. Ensure follow-up appointment with PCP is completed. Review sleep patterns and hydration.

additionalNotes: Youth has no history of migraines. Parents were appreciative of prompt medical attention. Youth feeling better by evening.

summary: Youth accidentally broke plate during dinner cleanup
description: During evening cleanup after dinner, Youth C was carrying dishes to the kitchen when they accidentally dropped a ceramic plate. The plate broke into several pieces on the floor. Youth immediately apologized and appeared genuinely upset about the accident. No one was injured.
antecedents: Normal dinner service. Youth was participating appropriately in cleanup duties.
behavior: Youth was carrying dishes carefully but lost grip on plate. Immediately stopped and apologized. Offered to help clean up.
consequences: Staff reassured youth that accidents happen. Youth helped sweep up broken pieces under staff supervision. Youth completed remaining cleanup duties without incident.

witnesses.name: Youth D
witnesses.statement: I saw it happen. It was an accident. Youth C was being careful.

immediateActions.notes: Ensured no one stepped on broken pieces
Youth C helped sweep under supervision

additionalNotes: Minor incident. Youth handled situation appropriately. No concerns.
